newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: Ke Mong Sa shrs up on new business talk.
newsitem.headline: Ke Mong Sa shrs up on new business talk.

text.p: Shares in South Korea's Ke Mong Sa Publishing Co went limit-up early Thursday on talk that the company's plan to import and sell electronic devices made by a Japanese firm would sharply boost its profits, brokers said.
Ke Mong Sa shares rose 2,700 won to 36,600 at 0215 GMT, 15 minutes before the end of the morning session.
"There's talk that the new business would contribute to sharply raising the company's earnings in the future," said Koh Kyung-bae of Hyundai Securities.
An official at the book publishing company confirmed it has been negotiating with a Japanese company to import infrared consumer devices.
The official declined to give more details.
